articles.author: MELANIE LIDMAN and KAREEM CHEHAYEB
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The Israeli military said Sunday that it killed another high-ranking Hezbollah official in an airstrike as the Lebanese militant group was reeling from a string of devastating blows and the killing of its overall leader, Hassan Nasrallah.
articles.title: Israel says it has killed another high-ranking Hezbollah official in an airstrike

articles.author: ABBY SEWELL
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Smoke was still rising from Beirut’s southern suburbs Saturday morning, visible to many of the families who had fled their homes there the night before to escape Israel’s massive bombardment.
articles.title: Hundreds of fleeing families sleep on beaches and streets after Israel's strikes shake Beirut

articles.author: STEPHEN SMITH, KATE PAYNE and HEATHER HOLLINGSWORTH
articles.description: PERRY, Fla. (AP) — Massive rains from powerful Hurricane Helene left people stranded, without shelter and awaiting rescue, as the cleanup began from a tempest that killed at least 64 people, caused widespread destruction across the U.S.
articles.title: At least 64 dead after Helene's deadly march across the Southeast

articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. (AP) — As Donald Trump railed against immigrants Saturday afternoon in the Rust Belt, his supporters in the Deep South had turned his earlier broadsides into a rallying cry over a college football game as they prepared for the former president’s visit later in the evening.
articles.title: In Alabama, Trump goes from the dark rhetoric of his campaign to adulation of college football fans

articles.author: STEPHANIE LIECHTENSTEIN
articles.description: VIENNA (AP) — Austrians voted Sunday in a national election that the far-right Freedom Party is hoping to win for the first time, tapping into anxieties about immigration, inflation, Ukraine and other concerns following recent gains for the hard right elsewhere in Europe.
articles.title: Austrians vote as a far-right party hopes for its first national election win

articles.author: BINAJ GURUBACHARYA
articles.description: KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) — Rescuers in Nepal recovered dozens of bodies from buses and other vehicles that were buried in landslides near the capital Kathmandu, as the death toll from flooding rose to at least 129 with dozens missings, officials said Sunday.
articles.title: At least 129 are dead in floods and landslides in Nepal

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD and RAF CASERT
articles.description: BRUSSELS (AP) — Pope Francis demanded Sunday that sexually abusive clergy be judged and their bishops stop covering up their crimes as he ended a troubled visit to Belgium by responding to the outrage over the scandal here that has devastated the church’s credibility.
articles.title: Pope wraps troubled visit to Belgium by praising victims and demanding abusers be judged

articles.author: ILLIA NOVIKOV and ANTON SHTUKA
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Their costumes are put on with surgical precision: Floppy hats, foam noses, bright clothes, and a ukulele with multicolored nylon strings. Moments later, in a beige hospital ward normally filled with the beeping sounds of medical machinery, there are bursts of giggles and silly singing.
articles.title: Hospital clowns bring joy to young Ukrainian cancer patients who survived Russian missile attack

articles.author: SAMUEL PETREQUIN
articles.description: LIGNORELLES, France (AP) — On a brisk late September morning in the heart of Chablis wine country, grape pickers haul large and heavy buckets over their shoulders, drenched in sweat as they climb the very steep slope of the Vau de Vey vineyard.
articles.title: Climate change and harsh weather in France bring challenges to Chablis wine country

articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — “Saturday Night Live” began its 50th season with a parade of former co-stars, including Maya Rudolph as Vice President Kamala Harris, Andy Samberg as her husband Doug Emhoff and Dana Carvey as President Joe Biden.
articles.title: Maya Rudolph as Harris and Dana Carvey as Biden open the 50th season of 'Saturday Night Live'
